channel.title: Posts on COMP6447 Musings
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on COMP6447 Musings

item.title: Fuzzing
item.description: Fuzz Testing Fuzzing is an automated software testing technique that involves providing invalid or unexpected or random data as inputs to a program.

item.title: Memory Protection
item.description: Prevention Stack reorder, randomised padding Canary FORTIFY RELRO Write good code Mitigation ASLR / PIE Randomisation NX Pointer Authentication Hypervisor Use checksec to figure out what memory protection technologies are applied to a given binary

item.title: Global Offset Table
item.description: GOT - Global Offset Table Every binary contains a jump table that points to functions of other libraries - this is known as the Global Offset Table.

item.title: Shellcode
item.description: Normal programs don’t have a win function :(.

item.title: Tutorial 2
item.description: Overflowing Buffers When overriding function returns, we need to pad BUFFER + VARS + EBP When overriding variables, we need to pad BUFFER + VARS

item.title: Threat Modelling
item.description: Which part of a program/system are we attacking?

item.title: Memory in x86 Systems
item.description: Registers in the x86 processor are 32 bits wide.
